law.catch_line: Use of toilet facilities in public or semipublic building -- Conditions -- Immunity from civil liability.

section.section:
The public or semipublic building operator is not civilly liable for any act or omission in allowing a person that has an eligible medical condition or uses an ostomy device to use an employee toilet facility that is not a public rest room if the act or omission meets the following requirements:
It is not willful or grossly negligent; and
It occurs in an area of the public or semipublic building that is not accessible to the public.

The public or semipublic building operator is not civilly liable to any individual accompanying a person with an eligible medical condition or who uses an ostomy device upon the same conditions and requirements as those set forth in subsection (2)(a) of this section.

text.section: The public or semipublic building operator is not required to make any physical changes to an employee toilet facility under KRS 211.394 and this section.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 85, sec. 36, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 23, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2008.
